channel.title: Wack Pack Stories
channel.itunes:author: Optimus Prime
channel.description: Tales from wack packers and the Howard Stern Show
channel.itunes:summary: Behind the scenes stories and outrageous moments from Howard Sterns iconic radio personalities.

itunes:category.text: Comedy > Comedy Interviews, Entertainment > TV & Film, Society & Culture > Personal Journals

item.title: Wack Pack Wars: When Misfits Collide
item.itunes:title: Wack Pack Wars: When Misfits Collide
item.description:
Dive into the most explosive confrontations and unforgettable rivalries that have shaped the Howard Stern Show's legendary Wack Pack in this gripping episode of Wack Pack Stories. From High Pitch Erik's shocking legal troubles following threatening messages to Fred the Elephant Boy, to the entertaining holiday showdown between Tan Mom and Medicated Pete's families, this episode unravels the complex dynamics that make these eccentric personalities so captivating. Witness the dramatic 2016 incident where Erik's social media dispute over SSI benefits escalated into serious legal consequences, and Howard's subsequent attempts to mediate peace between the feuding parties. Experience the tension and hilarity of the 2018 Christmas-themed "Wack Pack Feud" game show, featuring revealing family moments from both teams. The episode pays special tribute to Fred the Elephant Boy, whose 2023 passing marked the end of an era in Wack Pack history. Through personal anecdotes, behind-the-scenes revelations, and archived audio clips, this installment captures the raw, unfiltered essence of these larger-than-life characters who've become integral to the Howard Stern Show's enduring legacy.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Private Parts" - Movie (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/B000GUL9VM) • "The History of Howard Stern" - Documentary Series (https://www.amazon.com/History-Howard-Stern/dp/B000V7HBQU) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-features/wack-pack-oral-history-howard-stern-show-698430/)

item.title: When Wack Pack Roasts Get Wild: The Art of Stern Show Savagery
item.itunes:title: When Wack Pack Roasts Get Wild: The Art of Stern Show Savagery
item.description:
Dive into the raw, unfiltered world of Howard Stern's most memorable Wack Pack roasts in this revealing episode of Stern Show Stories. From Beetlejuice's legendary comebacks to High Pitch Erik's piercing insults, we explore the unique phenomenon that has become a cornerstone of Stern Show entertainment. The episode highlights Sal Governale's reputation as the show's most savage roaster, whose brutal takedowns of fellow staff members like Gary "Baba Booey" Dell'Abate and JD Harmeyer have become legendary among fans. We examine how these roasts break every rule of conventional comedy, featuring real people with real quirks who transform into unexpected comedic forces. The show delves into recent developments, including Beetlejuice's triumphant return after a five-year absence and High Pitch Erik's evolution into a Cameo sensation. Through archival clips and behind-the-scenes stories, this episode captures the essence of what makes Wack Pack roasts a last bastion of truly unfiltered comedy in today's sanitized media landscape. From Elegant Elliot Offen's unique delivery to the cringe-worthy moments that have defined these roasts, discover why these uncensored exchanges remain one of the most compelling aspects of the Howard Stern Show's enduring legacy.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Private Parts" - Movie (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/B000GUL9VM) • "The Wack Pack: An Unauthorized History" - Book (https://amazon.com/Wack-Pack-Unauthorized-History/dp/1542995736) • "Miss America" - Book (https://amazon.com/Miss-America-Howard-Stern/dp/0060391677)

item.title: Love in the Wack Pack: Bizarre Hearts and Beautiful Misfits
item.itunes:title: Love in the Wack Pack: Bizarre Hearts and Beautiful Misfits
item.description:
Dive into the unconventional world of romance as "Wack Pack Stories" explores the heartwarming and often hilarious love lives of Howard Stern's most memorable characters. This eye-opening episode peels back the layers of the Wack Pack's most intriguing relationships, from Bigfoot's endearing 30-year romance with Melody (whom he consistently called by the wrong name) to High Pitch Erik's dramatic love triangle. Through candid interviews and archival footage, we witness how these unique personalities navigate love, loss, and connection in their own distinctive ways. The episode pays special tribute to Fred the Elephant Boy, whose passing in 2023 marked the end of an era for the Wack Pack, while celebrating his lasting impact on the community. From marriage proposals to misunderstandings, these raw and unfiltered stories reveal the universal desire for love that exists within even the most eccentric characters of the Howard Stern Show universe. As Mark the Bagger prepares to share his own romantic revelations in an upcoming memoir, this episode stands as a testament to the authentic and sometimes bizarre nature of human connection in the world of the Wack Pack.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Private Parts" - Movie (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/B000GUL9VM) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-features/wack-pack-oral-history-howard-stern-show-698032/) • "Miss America" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Miss-America-Howard-Stern/dp/0060391677)

item.title: The Day Eric the Actor Called: A Legend Begins
item.itunes:title: The Day Eric the Actor Called: A Legend Begins
item.description:
In this unforgettable episode of Wack Pack Stories, we revisit the momentous day when Eric the Actor first graced the Howard Stern Show airwaves. On September 19th, 2002, an unexpected call from Sacramento changed radio history forever when Eric Shaun Lynch's distinctive voice rang through to defend Kelly Clarkson. Standing at 3'5" and living with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, Eric's initial interaction sparked what would become one of the most legendary relationships in the show's history. From his adamant refusal to accept the nickname "Eric the Midget" to his passionate celebrity crushes, including Beverley Mitchell from 7th Heaven, Eric's unfiltered personality and unwavering determination made him an instant phenomenon. His recurring calls, marked by heated arguments with Howard, ambitious demands, and the infamous balloon saga, transformed him from a regular caller into a beloved Wack Pack icon. Despite his passing in 2014 at age 39, Eric's legacy endures through his memorable catchphrases, uncompromising attitude, and the indelible mark he left on the show's history. This episode captures the essence of how a simple phone call evolved into one of the most cherished chapters in Howard Stern Show history.
Further Reading: • Howard Stern Comes Again - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • Eric the Actor: A Tribute - Documentary (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Show-Eric-Actor/dp/B00NQGP4RE) • Rolling Stone's Eric the Actor Tribute (https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-news/eric-the-actor-howard-stern-show-wack-packer-dead-at-39-186727/) • The Wack Pack: An Oral History - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Wack-Pack-History-Howard-Stern/dp/1982144785)

item.title: From Wallflower to Wack Pack King: The Beetlejuice Story
item.itunes:title: From Wallflower to Wack Pack King: The Beetlejuice Story
item.description:
In this landmark episode of Wack Pack Stories, we delve into the extraordinary first appearance of Beetlejuice on The Howard Stern Show, a moment that would forever change radio history. On July 14, 1999, Lester Green, standing at 4'3" with microcephaly, quietly entered the studio alongside another performer from Sean Rooney's dwarf-tossing business. Despite not being the intended focus, Howard Stern's legendary instincts immediately recognized something special in Beetle. His unique personality and unpredictable responses created instant radio magic, leading Stern to declare him a "once in a lifetime guest." The episode reveals fascinating details about Beetle's debut, including actor Jerry O'Connell's surprising connection as he called in to share that Beetle was once his mother's student. From this humble beginning, Beetlejuice would go on to become a cultural phenomenon, appearing in Hollywood films, creating iconic catchphrases, and eventually being crowned the greatest Wack Packer of all time in 2015. This episode captures the essence of how an unexpected guest standing quietly in the back of the studio would become one of the most beloved figures in radio entertainment history, proving that true star power can emerge from the most unlikely sources.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Private Parts" - Movie (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/B000GUJZ0G) • "The History of Howard Stern" (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard-stern-history) • "Beetlejuice: The Big Man Despite His Size" (https://www.howardstern.com/show/beetlejuice)

item.title: From Crack to Comeback: The Crackhead Bob Story
item.itunes:title: From Crack to Comeback: The Crackhead Bob Story
item.description:
In this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories, we delve into the unforgettable moment when George Harvey, better known as Crackhead Bob, first graced the Howard Stern Show airwaves on November 7th, 1995. From his iconic first words "Dip da dip da dip," Bob's journey from addiction survivor to beloved Wack Pack member captivated millions of listeners. After suffering a devastating stroke from crack cocaine use that left him partially paralyzed with impaired speech, Harvey transformed his tragedy into triumph through his regular appearances on the show. His distinctive speech patterns and catchphrases like "ticky tie main" became legendary, but it was his resilient spirit and good-natured personality that truly endeared him to the Stern Show audience. Rather than becoming a cautionary tale, Bob's story evolved into one of radio's most remarkable comebacks, as he became a regular fixture on the show, participating in contests and public appearances. His impact extended far beyond comedy, demonstrating how authentic human connections can emerge from the most unexpected circumstances. Though we lost Bob in 2016 at age 56, his legacy as a Wack Pack legend continues to resonate with fans, reminding us that behind every memorable character lies a story of struggle, perseverance, and ultimately, triumph.
Further Reading: • Howard Stern Comes Again - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • The History of Howard Stern - Documentary (https://www.amazon.com/History-Howard-Stern/dp/B000VWEFP8) • Private Parts - Movie (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/B000GH3CRG) • Miss America - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Miss-America-Howard-Stern/dp/0060391677)

item.title: Benjy Bronk: The King of Late but Never Gone
item.itunes:title: Benjy Bronk: The King of Late but Never Gone
item.description:
Dive into one of the Howard Stern Show's most enigmatic characters in this revealing episode of Stern Show Stories exploring Benjy Bronk's notorious suspensions. From the implementation of the "Benjy Rule" in the early 2000s to his most infamous 2016 banishment from the studio, we unpack how chronic lateness and unconventional behavior shaped Benjy's unique legacy. Discover how this veteran writer's penchant for disruption through the infamous "Benjy Vortex" and headline-grabbing stunts like the "meatball eyes" incident have paradoxically cemented his place in Stern Show history. Despite multiple suspensions that would have ended other careers, Benjy's distinctive contributions to the show's dynamic, including his unmistakable laugh and writing talents, have created an enduring presence that continues to resonate with fans. This episode delves into why Benjy remains an irreplaceable figure in the Stern universe, examining how his unpredictable nature and genuine talent have helped him weather numerous disciplinary actions while maintaining his position as one of the show's most talked-about personalities through 2024 and beyond.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Private Parts" - Movie (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/B000GUJZ0Q) • "The History of Howard Stern" (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard100) • "Howard Stern: The Ultimate Insider's Story" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Ultimate-Insiders-Story/dp/0060391553)
